True. So let's do everything we can to make sure mail in votes are all counted and no results by the media are reported until a sufficient number of them are counted.

And I'm getting torched in another thread because I'm trying to make people vigilant about the mail voting problems. Here's what we need to do for the general.  


* Those who can, vote early
* Those voting by absentee ballot, if possible, return it themselves
* In states where both of those are impossible, if the lines are not too long and they can socially distance, maybe try to vote in person if they feel safe (those who have N95 masks should be safe)
* Public pressure for the Senate to pass the funding for the USPS that the House passed
* Public pressure for the USPS to prioritize elections ballots and get them to their destination on time if they were mailed by their states' deadlines
* Public pressure for states to allow pre-election day processing of mail-in ballots, which will help them be counted faster
* Public pressure for the media to resist reporting results until a sufficient number of mail-in ballots are counted, so it doesn't look like the GOP is winning a gargantuan landslide when only in-person votes are counted
* Encourage for Republicans to vote by mail, for the same reason as the bullet above.

Okay, then maybe I need to change my tone. I'm not trying to scare people out of voting, I'm trying to get us all to be pro-active and fix this problem. Maybe I should say, "If we don't fix this problem, there's a chance votes won't be counted." Is that better? I wrote in another comment what I think we need to do.  


[https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/comments/iluhzj/democrats\_should\_curb\_their\_enthusiasm\_for\_mailin/g3vctzx/?context=3](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/comments/iluhzj/democrats_should_curb_their_enthusiasm_for_mailin/g3vctzx/?context=3)

Those who are lambasting me, I am \*NOT\* saying that everyone should vote by mail. I'm just saying that we need to take this problem seriously and combat it. Here are some possible steps. Please add to them if you wish.  


* Those who can, vote early
* Those voting by absentee ballot, if possible, return it themselves
* In states where both of those are impossible, if the lines are not too long and they can socially distance, maybe try to vote in person if they feel safe (those who have N95 masks should be safe)
* Public pressure for the Senate to pass the funding for the USPS that the House passed

* Public pressure for states to allow pre-election day processing of mail-in ballots, which will help them be counted faster
* Public pressure for the media to resist reporting results until a sufficient number of mail-in ballots are counted, so it doesn't look like the GOP is winning a gargantuan landslide when only in-person votes are counted
* Encourage for Republicans to vote by mail, for the same reason as the bullet above.

You make a lot of good points. I myself am voting by absentee ballot, but rather than mailing it in, I'm bringing it back to the elections office myself. There are a lot of things we need to be doing in preparation for this. Sticking our heads in the sand is not one of them. I'm going to write a response to the main thread about this.

Holy shit, I'm not saying everyone should vote in person. I'm just saying that we need to take this problem seriously, and address it, or else we're fucking dead because the GOP will absolutely steal the fucking election. What I'm personally doing is getting an absentee ballot, but rather than mail it in, I'm bringing it back to the elections office directly. I hope a huge portion of Dems voting by absentee ballot do that, if their state allows it. I hope Dem voters in states that allow early voting to take advantage of that as much as possible. If we get a huge percentage early voting that could help tremendously. I also hope that more Republicans decide to vote by mail, which would blunt the effect of an election night where Trump looks like he won because they haven't counted mail-ins. And maybe in places where the lines are not too long, I hope that, yes, some more Dems vote in person, if they can socially distance and feel safe. Furthermore, we need to apply public pressure for the USPS to prioritize election ballots and get them back in time, for the GOP Senate to pass the funding for the USPS that the House passed, for states to extend election deadlines, for the media to refuse to start showing results until mail-ins are counted, for the media to make it clear that we probably won't know the election winner the night of the election. How the hell is the entire Democratic party so complacent about this? You really don't think Trump will steal this fucking election?

But this threat is real. Trump has sabotaged the USPS, and now millions of votes might not make it in time. And another problem is that, even if enough Dem votes make it in time, they're counted much slower. This means Trump will look like he's winning on election night, claim victory, and and then insist any attempt to count the mail-in votes will make for a fraudulent election. And then it would be up to the courts. He very much can steal this election.

As I see it, millions of votes -- the vast majority Democratic -- will be discounted after arriving late, giving the GOP a stolen victory at all levels. Can anyone talk me down from the ledge here? Do we have a chance at a semi-fair election?

The general looks like it's going to be even worse. The mail is severely backed up and running behind now, which could put millions of mail-in votes in danger of arriving late. Since far more Democrats than Republicans are planning on voting by mail this year, it's beginning to look like the GOP has already stolen this election at all levels.

Unfortunately, I don't see how this is backfiring on the GOP. Trump has sabotaged the USPS. Postal service delivery has slowed to a trickle, and packages are arriving a month late. Since far more Democrats than Republicans plan on voting by mail, and late ballots won't be counted, millions or perhaps tens of millions more Dem votes than GOP votes will be thrown out. Given this, hasn't Trump already successfully stolen the election? Can anyone talk me down from the ledge here?
